com.cloudpos.rfcardreader

Interface RFCardReaderDevice

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Device, TimeConstants

    public interface RFCardReaderDevice
extends Device, TimeConstants
    The RFCardReaderDevice interface defines the RFCard reader APIs to be used by the applications.

    The RFCard reader device object is obtained from the POSTerminal, its' as follows: 

     RFCardReaderDevice rFCardReaderDevice =
         (RFCardReaderDevice) POSTerminal.getInstance().getDevice("cloudpos.device.rfcardreader");
    Among them, the "cloudpos.device.rfcardreader" string is to identify the RFCard reader device, defined by the specific implementation.

    Uses the RFCard reader device object to control the operation of the printer device.

    An app can request permission to access the device, as shown below: 

     <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.CLOUDPOS_CONTACTLESS_CARD"/>
    See Also:
    Device

      • open

        void open(int logicalID,
        int mode)
          throws DeviceException
        Opens the device with a specific communication mode.

        Resets the state of the initiator if it has previously been opened.

        Parameters:
        logicalID - logical ID of the device to open.
        mode - Communication mode to use.
        Throws:
        DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException.

      • listenForCardPresent

        void listenForCardPresent(OperationListener listener,
                        int timeout)
                          throws DeviceException
        Starts reader according to Contactless protocols and performs initialization according to the communication mode.

        This is an asynchronous method. handleResult() will be invoked when at least one card has been detected in the field.

        Only support a single card, many cards will report error ERR_MULTI_CARD

        This method will use parameters previously added with setSpeed(). If none has been set, scanTargets will behave with a typical behavior adapted to the selected communication mode.

        Information about successfully detected card can be retrieved by the getCard() function.

        Because this method uses a timeout parameter, the device receiving this request MUST be able to successfully respond to cancelRequest() and abort the operation.

        In case of a timeout occurring, the operation result will contain code= ERR_TIMEOUT, and no information about card will be available.

        Parameters:
        listener - operation listener.
        timeout - the maximum scanning time of the method, in milliseconds.
        Throws:
        DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException

      • waitForCardPresent

        RFCardReaderOperationResult waitForCardPresent(int timeout)
                                               throws DeviceException
        This is the synchronous method of the listenForCardPresent(OperationListener,int).
        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum scanning time of the method, in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        the card of scanning. null if scanning timeout.
        Throws:
        DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException

      • listenForCardAbsent

        void listenForCardAbsent(OperationListener listener,
                       int timeout)
                         throws DeviceException
        Listens until a card is removed from this terminal. A callback will be called when the card is removed or the card is absent already.

        This is an asynchronous method.

        Result information about successfully removed card can be retrieved by the SUCCESS function.

        Because this method uses a timeout parameter, the device receiving this request MUST be able to successfully respond to cancelRequest() and abort the operation.

        In case of a timeout occurring, the operation result will contain code= ERR_TIMEOUT, and no information about card will be available.

        Parameters:
        listener - operation listener.
        timeout - the maximum wait time of the method, in milliseconds.
        Throws:
        DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException

      • waitForCardAbsent

        RFCardReaderOperationResult waitForCardAbsent(int timeout)
                                              throws DeviceException
        This is the synchronous method of the listenForCardAbsent(OperationListener,int).
        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum wait time of the method, in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        RFCardReaderOperationResult
        Throws:
        DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException
